pros: your shift ends at some point

Clinical staff is super burned out. Communication poor. Won't consider any changes unless it involves earning a penny.

pros: Good medical support, reasonable consultants, uses epic

job_title: Dietary Aide in Wisconsin Rapids, WI
pros: There is not one thing I can think of.

job_title: Advanced Practice Provider (PA/NP) in Wausau, WI

Didn't decrease the health care premiums nor deductibles (they went up) and didn't increase the amount that the company contributes toward retirement. No cost of living increase in 5 years!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Stevens Point, WI
pros: Co-workers are great! Very supportive of each other. Schedule of M-F is good, don't have to work nights.
cons: Leadership is very disorganized. they proudly talk about the "matrix style" of leadership, but this appears to mean "no accountability". Really poor communication. Face to face interaction is no longer valued. Changes continue from the acquisition of Ascension into Aspirus and it has been ROUGH going. Leadership proudly states "no one will lose their job", while they inform employees by emails of clinic closures and how their schedules will change. And if you don't like your new location or schedule then you can quit. But at least the company avoids the bad press of layoffs and downsizing. This organization is definitely not headed in the right direction.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Stevens Point, WI
pros: -Coworkers really worked together as a team -Over time, doctors and nurses, trusted our evaluation of patients -Genuinely miss my coworkers
cons: -Administration/management only cared about “following rules” instead of the patients needs or putting their best interests first. -At a growing 24/7 ER..it didn’t make “financial sense” to have any type of security there. But “locking the doors” (that by the way you can easily break in to) and doors that we HAVE to open for every patient because it’s illegal if you don’t. That doesn’t constitute the safety of their employees.

review_title: Upper management only cares about their own well being
pros: Great co workers. Good team environment. Decent pay.
cons: Upper management does not about lower level employees. They didn't think it was necessary to have any kind of security at a 24/7 ER. "It isn't worth a full time salary and benefits." Do you know how many times there were safety issues? Too many, but it still isn't worth it. The last ER management only cared about following the rules and making sure he looked good to advance his career.

pros: Great people to work with.
cons: Staff retention is poor. Lots of locum doctors a d traveling nurses. Lots of floating to other units.

pros: Generally 9-5 atmosphere as a midwestern company
cons: Healthcare benefits, PTO and promotion options are okay. nothing too impressive.

review_title: Lots of things to work on to retain staff...

job_title: Industrial Athletic Trainer in Wausau, WI
pros: Flexible hours right now -
cons: Was better before aspirus took over. Department is being flushed out. No paid holidays. Have to use own PTO when the clinic is closed for a holiday.

pros: The coworkers are nice. People are caring and protective of each other. They hold each other up. Certain managers will hear you out and do their best for you.
cons:
When I first started, the work was reasonable and enjoyable.

After purchasing 9 hospitals in 3 years, I hate my job. If you complete a project well you will be assigned four more. There is no respect for work life balance. 

You are underpaid, underappreciated, and, at time, micromanaged.

Benefits aren't great, health insurance has gone up quite a bit in the past 3 years. Max raise even if you are a superstar is 3% a year. PTO days at the start are 19 days but this includes 6 holidays so its only 13 days off of your choice (this goes up marginally after 5 years)

Brave enough to ask for a raise? You will get laughed at. Want to comp a day because you worked 55+ hours so far this week? The answer is no. 

Many roles are single threaded. So you can't enjoy time off and will still get called when you are off. There isn't a strong mentorship or onboarding process. People are exhausted.

job_title: Health & Wellness Specialist in Wausau, WI
pros: Manager was trusting and flexible. Great team.
cons: Limits with what you are doing. Lots of health coaching.

review_title: Too big to care for employees or patients
pros: Used to be a place of which you could be proud to work. Staff genuinely care about patients.
cons: Leadership has lost sight of the point in their constant search for more hospitals to buy. About 5 years ago, it began to show that they didn’t care about employees, but still cared about the patient experience. Now it is very clear they do not care about employees at all and don’t really care about patients either. Staff is so over worked and under staffed and instead of addressing that or providing pay or benefit increases, it’s been cut or reduced. They continually ask staff to bend over backwards but do not invest in them. Because staff are so poorly cared for, it’s starting to impact patients. We want to provide excellent care but it’s becoming impossible.

pros:
Benefits
Staff
Individual providers
Cleanliness of facilities
Reception Staff
cons: Management de-values longevity/experience, making years of experience, a liability. They are looking for ways to decrease costs, but unfortunately go about it by replacing loyal employees with low-cost alternatives. job_title: Patient Service Representative in Wausau, WI
pros: The team of individuals I worked with were nothing short of amazing, everyone worked together as a team to provide the best possible care and experience for the patients as well as their families and loved ones.  The doctors and surgeons in the cardiovascular unit are the absolute best in their fields and have proved this time and time again, I am filled with pride and honor simply being able to say that I worked with such a talented group of individuals and at a top 50 cardiovascular hospitals in the nation, I was saddened when I had to resign due to relocating.
cons: As with any company or organization there are some days that are harder than others. Some days it gets overwhelming with the amount of patients coming in for procedures or tests, whether they were scheduled or not. Emotions can run high when family members are waiting for news about their loved one having surgery and they can sometimes take their frustrations out on the first person they see but you simply have to put yourself in their shoes and empathize with how they are feeling and why

review_title: Unfortunate decline in quality and patient safety
pros:
Great team members, adjacent team cooperation, exposure to technology (not cutting or bleeding edge however but that's healthcare)

Ample parking
cons:
Management, directorship are clueless, play favorites, act on emotion rather than being professional. Back-handed intentions. There's a reason they've gone through so many managers and directors here with engineers and admins seeking to leave. 

Yearly reviews are a joke and nobody understands them. There's a survey annually to rate things like pace of work, mgmt, etc which is ignored. Used to have the CIO on it until they received unfavorable reviews. Next year they were removed. Director received unfavorable reviews on the next year's, the following the director was removed from the survey. 

Have to fight to get fair pay and even then you're barely at market rate. Others in the area pay much better and have greater benefits. Benefits including 401k, health, paid time off are mediocre and getting worse every year.

Epic analysts routinely skirt around protocol and will view patient and coworker health records in a way that is deliberately uneasy to audit.

review_title: Aspirus has great reputation in community, with caring staff.
pros:
Senior management has excellent vision.
Benefits are good in comparison with other companies.
Caring employees who put the patient first.
Flexibility in scheduling.
cons:
Middle management is too concerned with dollars and doesn't address concerns of staff under them.
Many excellent employees end up leaving because the "problem" employees and issues aren't dealt with;high turnover.
No recognition for going above and beyond what is expected; employees who coast along, or just barely get by, receive same recognition (and pay increases) as stellar employees.

pros: One of things I liked about Aspirus was each individual unit did the scheduling according to what worked for them. In each department, each shift was looked at individually and decided upon according to what worked for the employee and also the department. Very, very flexible.
cons: Towards the end of my employment there, slowly Unit Clerks job description was lessening more and more. We Unit Clerks actually were to start teaching our job to the doctors and nurses and eventually eliminating us. I felt that the hospital was already understaffed companywide including Unit Clerks and now we are suppose to give more work to the nurses and doctors while our job, which was highly needed, was slowly going away.

review_title: Listen to,  but don’t hear their employees
job_title: Critical Care Paramedic in Wausau, WI
pros: The staff is hard working and dedicated to quality patient care.
cons: The management likes to keep staff in the dark about mission critical information, play the “reactive”  game of  vs. being proactive. Due to their rapid growth their is a culture of micromanaging as a means of self preservation by management. This hurts the staff-management relationships.

pros: Ample opportunity for learning. Environment rich for those who want to learn many aspects of IT.
cons: Mangers and some directors tend to resemble the personalities of henchmen looking to lead by fear tactics. Really hurts morale and upper leadership is either clueless about it or encourages behavior.

pros: Loved working here.  Was extremely happy working in the IT department. Competitive salary.  Excellent training.  Nice co-workers. Good management.
cons: Was disappointed that my department did not understand personal issues or give flexibility when things outside the job affected work.  This was my reason for leaving. Would still be happily employed there had there been some compassion or empathy.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Wisconsin Rapids, WI
pros: None that I can think of
cons: Horrible management, grossly understaffed, have many, many years of experience with myriad positions and this is by far the worst place I have yet to work. Disorganized among other operating organizations/branches, new leadership is appalling, pay is average, benefits average, training is horrendous and lacks any major substance.  Frequently encouraged to work overtime without recording/getting paid. No home life whatsoever. The window dressing of this job is beautiful, until you are behind the ugly facade.  Steer clear!

pros: I have a great boss and flexible hours
cons: Desire for continuous improvement without proper staffing burns people out, management is not capable of empowering or delegating to staff
